Pretty breaks. Uses default R break algorithm as implemented in pretty().

Source: R/breaks.r
pretty_breaks.Rd

Pretty breaks. Uses default R break algorithm as implemented in pretty().

pretty_breaks(n = 5, ...)

Arguments

n

desired number of breaks
...

other arguments passed on to pretty()

Examples

pretty_breaks()(1:10)
#> [1]  0  2  4  6  8 10
pretty_breaks()(1:100)
#> [1]   0  20  40  60  80 100
pretty_breaks()(as.Date(c("2008-01-01", "2009-01-01")))
#>     Jan 2008     Apr 2008     Jul 2008     Oct 2008     Jan 2009 
#> "2008-01-01" "2008-04-01" "2008-07-01" "2008-10-01" "2009-01-01" 
pretty_breaks()(as.Date(c("2008-01-01", "2090-01-01")))
#>         2000         2020         2040         2060         2080         2100 
#> "2000-01-01" "2020-01-01" "2040-01-01" "2060-01-01" "2080-01-01" "2100-01-01"
